channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump administration looks to slash HUD workers tackling the housing crisis

item.description: When 11-year-old Ceiba Phillips returned to his Southern California neighborhood a month after the devastating Eaton fire, he couldn’t believe his eye...

item.title: Some agencies tell employees to hold off responding to latest Musk email
item.description: Multiple federal agencies appeared to be caught off guard by the Elon Musk-directed email from the Office of Personnel Management.

item.title: Man serving 5 life prison sentences walks free after judge gives second chance
item.description: A man sentenced to life in prison, with what seemed like no chance of getting out, is now free. That's because of a 90-year-old judge who is trying to...

item.title: DOGE's Musk says federal employees must document their work or resign
item.description: Elon Musk's instructions came after President Trump praised the head of DOGE but would like to see him get more aggressive in reducing the federal gov...

item.title: Pope's condition remains critical after 'asthmatic respiratory crisis': Vatican
item.description: Asthmatic respiratory crisis indicates the pope struggled to maintain a sufficient oxygen level when breathing on his own, according to medical expert...

item.title: At Least 3 People Killed and 79 Injured After Roof Collapses at Shopping Mall: Reports
'See you in court': Trump clashes with Democratic governor at White House event
item.description: At a White House event with a bipartisan group of governors Friday, President Donald Trump briefly sparred with Democratic Maine Gov. Janet Mills.

item.title: California governor asks Congress for nearly $40 billion for LA wildfire relief

item.title: LA mayor dismisses fire chief over response to most destructive wildfire in city history last month
Musk orders US federal workers to report on work by Monday or resign
Trump administration fires workers at NIH Alzheimer's research center
item.description: The center's incoming director was among those terminated.

item.title: President Zelensky is not accepting the proposed U.S. deal
Judge frees New York man after sentencing him to 5 life terms 27 years ago
item.description: Walter "King Tut" Johnson was sentenced to five life terms in 1997 by a judge who later released him from prison after 27 years.

item.title: The Justice Department | Sunday on 60 Minutes
item.description: This Sunday, Scott Pelley examines the recent firings and resignations at the U.S. Department of Justice.
